properties.Name: InsuranceCoverageCategory
properties.Description:
A categorization or grouping of insurance coverage types based on common characteristics, objectives and similar criteria.

Boat Ex:
- LIABILITY
- MEDICAL EXPENSES
- COMPREHENSIVE
- COLLISION
- OTHER

Condominium Ex:
- BUILDING PROPERTY PROTECTION
- PERSONAL PROPERTY PROTECTION
- LIABILITY PROTECTION
- MEDICAL PROTECTION
- LIVING EXPENSES

where:

BUILDING PROPERTY PROTECTION
This protection covers items which are situated within your home-for example, fixtures, construction materials and supplies.

PERSONAL PROPERTY PROTECTION
Includes all of your personal belongings, big and small. Personal Property Protection provides protection against covered loss to movable property like a stereo, bicycle, furniture or clothing.

LIABILITY PROTECTION
Family Liability Protection provides protection for insured persons who become legally obligated to pay for covered accidental bodily injury or property damage to others. This protection does not cover auto liability claims.

MEDICAL PROTECTION
Medical Protection provides protection for your guests, who are accidentally injured on your property as a result of a covered loss. This protection pays for the   reasonable and necessary medical expenses they incur, regardless of who was at fault.

LIVING EXPENSES
Living Expenses reimburses you for a reasonable increase in living expenses necessary to maintain your normal standard of living, up to the   amount of time specified in your policy. This may include payments for the   additional costs of a place to stay, food, and/or other increased living expenses.

Earthquake Ex:
- DWELLING
- PERSONAL PROPERTY
- OTHER

Flood Ex:
- BUILDING COVERAGE
- CONTENTS COVERAGE
- EXCESS FLOOD COVERAGE
- LOSS AVOIDANCE MEASURES

where:

BUILDING COVERAGE
Protects the   structure of your home or business. It includes above-ground appliances and other items of property that are considered to be part of the   building:

- Central air conditioners, refrigerators and walk-in freezers

- Built-in dishwashers, built-in microwaves, ranges, cooking stoves and ovens

- Hot water heaters, furnaces, radiators and garbage disposal units

- Awnings, blinds and canopies

- Carpet permanently installed over unfinished flooring

- Permanently installed cupboards, bookcases, cabinets, paneling and wallpaper 

-  Elevator equipment, fire sprinkler systems, light fixtures and plumbing fixtures

- Outdoor antennas and aerials fastened to buildings

In a basement, which is defined as any room where the   floor is below ground on all sides, coverage is limited to the   following:

- Furnaces, hot water heaters, water softeners, central air conditioners and heat pumps     

- Utility connections, fuel and water tanks, and sump pumps 

- Unfinished structure, dry wall or sheet rock walls and fiberglass insulation   

- Electrical wiring and circuit breaker boxes

- Cleanup after a flood

- Clothes washers, dryers and food freezers located below ground in a basement** are not covered under Building Coverage. However, Contents Coverage can be purchased separately for these items.

CONTENTS COVERAGE
Contents Coverage can be purchased for your personal property items located in the   building above ground. Personal property items include:

-  Clothing and furniture    

-  Portable or window-type air-conditioning units    

- Portable microwaves and portable dishwashers 

- Carpets over finished flooring located above ground    

- Carpets not permanently installed over unfinished flooring

- Cook-out" grills

- Food freezers (other than walk-ins, which are covered under Building Coverage)

- Clothes washers and dryers

Clothes washers, dryers and food freezers are only covered by Contents Coverage, whether they are located above ground or below ground in a basement.**

EXCESS FLOOD COVERAGE
In some states, if you purchase standard a National Flood Insurance policy or Preferred Risk Flood Insurance through Allstate and find you need more coverage than the   maximum limit provided by the   NFIP program, you may be eligible to purchase additional coverage through an Excess Flood Insurance policy***

LOSS AVOIDANCE MEASURES
The   base insurance plan also includes up to $1,000 for reasonable expenses, such as sandbagging, incurred to protect your property from the   imminent danger of a flood.

Homeowners Ex:
- VEHICLE
- PERSONAL PROPERTY
- DWELLING
- COLLISION
- REPAIRS
- PERIL

where:

PERIL
The   reference is to any number of events that could create damage that the   policy covers.

Motorcycle Ex:
- ACCESSORIES
- BODILY INJURY LIABILITY 
- MEDICAL PAYMENTS
- UNINSURED MOTORISTS 
- COMPREHENSIVE PHYSICAL DAMAGE 
- COLLISION 
- PROPERTY DAMAGE LIABILITY 

where:

ACCESSORIES
If you carry comprehensive or collision coverage, your policy will include coverage for your accessories (coverage amounts vary by state). Accessories may include: saddlebags, backrests, seats, chrome pieces and CB radios. If needed, additional coverage can be purchased. GEICO® Motorcycle insurance collision coverage provides protection for your helmet

BODILY INJURY LIABILITY 
Provides protection if you injure or kill someone while operating your motorcycle. It also provides for a legal defense if another party in the   accident files a lawsuit against you. Bodily injury liability covers injury to people, not your vehicle.

MEDICAL PAYMENTS, NO-FAULT OR PERSONAL INJURY PROTECTION 
Usually pays for medical expenses of the   injured driver and passenger.

UNINSURED MOTORISTS 
Pays for your injuries caused by an uninsured driver in a crash that is not your fault.

COMPREHENSIVE PHYSICAL DAMAGE 
Pays for damage to your motorcycle from theft, vandalism, flood, fire or other covered perils.

COLLISION 
Pays for damage to your motorcycle when your motorcycle hits or is hit by another vehicle or object.

PROPERTY DAMAGE LIABILITY 
Pays for damage to someone else's property resulting from an accident for which you are at fault and provides you with a legal defense.

Personal Umbrella Liability Ex:
- LIABILITY
- MEDICAL EXPENSES
- COMPREHENSIVE
- COLLISION
- UNINSURED MOTORIST
- OTHER

Recreational Vehicle (RV) Ex:
- LIABILITY
- MEDICAL EXPENSES
- COMPREHENSIVE
- COLLISION
- UNINSURED MOTORIST
- OTHER

Renters Ex:
- Personal Property
- Liability
- Medical
- Expenses

where:

PERSONAL PROPERTY PROTECTION
Includes all of your personal belongings, big and small. Personal Property Protection provides protection against covered loss to movable property like a stereo, bicycle, furniture or clothing.

LIABILITY PROTECTION
Family Liability Protection provides protection for insured persons who become legally obligated to pay for covered accidental bodily injury or property damage to others. This protection does not cover auto liability claims.

MEDICAL PROTECTION
Medical Protection provides protection for your guests, who are accidentally injured on your property as a result of a covered loss. This protection pays for the   reasonable and necessary medical expenses they incur, regardless of who was at fault.

LIVING EXPENSES
Living Expenses reimburses you for a reasonable increase in living expenses necessary to maintain your normal standard of living, up to the   amount of time specified in your policy. This may include payments for the   additional costs of a place to stay, food, and/or other increased living expenses.

Vehicle Ex:
- LIABILITY
- MEDICAL EXPENSES
- COMPREHENSIVE
- COLLISION
- UNINSURED MOTORIST
- OTHER
